project.teaser: Using a deliberative approach, ECOSENS will analyse citizens’ views and risk perceptions, benefits and potentials of current and new nuclear technologies in the context of major societal challenges (climate crisis, sustainable energy policies, energy security). It will...
project.objective: Using a deliberative approach, ECOSENS will analyse citizens’ views and risk perceptions, benefits and potentials of current and new nuclear technologies in the context of major societal challenges (climate crisis, sustainable energy policies, energy security). It will review through a socio-ethical lens the uptake of recommendations on stakeholder engagement and transdisciplinarity (notably integration of social sciences and humanities) in nuclear research and decision making, developing recommendations to overcome challenges. Societal stakeholders (authorities, industry, academia and civil society) are engaged to explore and co-construct possible energy futures and the role of nuclear energy therein. Sustainability assessment of current nuclear energy technologies will take into account the entire life of the nuclear investment including the nuclear fuel cycle. Integration of new technologies (Gen III+, IV, SMR) is then explored in the context of the future energy market and societal developments to identify the possible roles of nuclear energy in the climate neutral economy targeted for 2050. Multiple perspectives (nuclear experts, social scientist, stakeholder, society) are integrated and methodological recommendations for sustainability assessment are agreed. To address the weaknesses of existing economic models, ECOSENS develops a novel model based on the system of provision approach in order to create and calculate indicators relevant for a plethora of stakeholders (consumers, governments, suppliers). The model will include the “social discount rate” and considers the limits of our planet, as reflected in the “circular economy” system. A series of national case studies evaluates the model and provides relevant recommendations to stakeholders. ECOSENS activities and results will be largely communicated and disseminated through the network of stakeholders established to support innovative involvement, as well as through Open Access facilities.
project.title: Economic and Social Considerations for the Future of Nuclear Energy in Society
project.keywords: stakeholder engagement, nuclear energy sustainability, nuclear energy costs, social discount rate, circular economy

article.title: Sustainability assessment for the future of nuclear energy

result.title: SoP systematic review
result.description: A comprehensive synthesis of the scientific literature on SoP and relevant examples in industrial sectors

result.title: Strategy and plan for communication, dissemination and exploitation of results
result.description: Overview of communication dissemination and exploitation activities with strategy and detailed plan also the process for the review and update will be given

result.title: Minutes of the 1st project meeting
result.description: The report will present the status in project implementation at 12 months, and the plans and measures for its continuation.

result.title: SoP Model - Enhanced
result.description: An enhanced version of the SoP useful for scenario analysis and derive meaningful results for publication

result.title: Practical recommendations for enhanced mechanisms of interaction between citizens, civil society, decision-makers and researchers
result.description: Based on analysis of the actual uptake and impact of stakeholder engagement recommendations in the nuclear field, and the results from Task 1.3 and Task 1.4, the deliverable formulates practical recommendations for enhanced mechanisms of interaction between citizens, civil society, decision-makers and researchers (in particular in social sciences and humanities, SSH).

result.title: Policy Brief
result.description: A short policy brief for policy and decision makers with recommendations covering both the consideration of novel criteria in the development of future energy infrastructure and the role of nuclear energy in the future EU energy mix.

result.title: Investigation on the sustainability of the entire life cycle of nuclear power
result.description: A set of nuclear systems will be selected and analyzed from the point of view of the sustainability indicators by considering the entire life of nuclear power. The systems will include current and future nuclear technologies.

result.title: Report on stakeholder engagement
result.description: Implementation of stakeholder engagement during the ECOSENS will be reported.

result.title: Case studies
result.description: Development of a series of national case studies to evaluates the model and provides relevant recommendations to stakeholders

result.title: Report from participatory workshops on social dimensions and sustainability assessments of nuclear energy
result.description: The deliverable includes a description and main conclusions from international workshops engaging societal stakeholders to explore their evidence- and value-based perspectives on sustainability and energy governance assessments and to explore with them possible energy futures, taking into account ongoing energy transitions and climate change and other major societal challenges.

result.title: Public attitudes towards nuclear technologies, including new and emerging technologies, in the context of climate crisis, sustainability and energy security
result.description: Analysis of perceived risks, benefits and potentials of nuclear technology (including new and emerging technologies) in the context of major societal challenges: climate crisis, sustainable energy policies and energy security.

result.title: Scenarios for climate neutral sector based on nuclear new technologies and variable renewables
result.description: A set of scenarios will be identified in the context of the next two decades of the development of the society and of the evolutions of the energy market The scenarios will be based on energy mix generated from low carbon energies nuclear and renewables

result.title: Mid-term Report
result.description: The deliverable will report on the results achieved by midterm of the project as well as on the financial aspects.

result.title: YouTube Video
result.description: YouTube video of about 10 minutes intended for the generalpublic. This video will also be available as a podcast on the common platforms (e.g. ITunes).

result.title: Minutes of the KoM
result.description: The report will present a summary of the discussions and decisions regarding the implementation of the project occasioned by the launch of the project

result.title: Social Discount Rate model
result.description: The model to establish the Social Discount Rate given contextual an project inputs

result.title: Impact of new social movements on attitudes towards energy matters and towards nuclear energy
result.description: Analysis of citizens, academia and civil society motivations for, and experiences with, engagement in protest or advocacy movements concerned with energy, sustainability and climate change in general and with nuclear energy in particular.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Data Management Plan will describe the data management life cycle for the data to be collected processed andor generated to assure compliance with the FAIR findable accessible interoperable and reusable principle

result.title: Proceeding from project events
result.description: For three project events: first findings, feedback to first outputs and final conference proceedings will be developed.

result.title: SoP Model - Minimum viable
result.description: A simplified version of the SoP useful for preliminary beta testing

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ECOSENS (Economic and Social Considerations for the Future of Nuclear Energy in Society)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: The effects of climate change (long heat waves, drought, extended vegetation fires, dramatic floods and tornadoes) and the more recent energy security aspects have become everyday facts confronting EU citizens. Reaching Zero Net Emissions by 2050 should concentrate the efforts...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Analysis of impact of societal and technological changes on the future energy market
result.description: The perspective of the technological development such as the impact of the disruptive technologies together with the societal possible transformation will be analyzed The potential impact on the energy market will be discussed

result.title: Report on Interdisciplinary Dialogue
result.description: The report will share ECOSENS findings on the interdisciplinary aspects and effects of our work directly engaging nuclear scientists and engineers, economists and social scientists from various disciplines and fields.

result.title: D2.1 - Assumptions, models, and methodology, for the development of nuclear energy in EU, on the next two decades
result.description: Based on the analysis of the potential development of nuclear power for the next two decades a set of meaningful assumptions will be selected to reduce the complexity Models and used methodology will developedselected and described in the deliverable The deliverable will include feedback from societal perspective based on the activities in T23

result.title: White Paper
result.description: White Paper with all the details of the novel ECOSENS full costs assessment model based on the SoP approach, its application and findings. This document is intended for decision makers and experts of energy systems

result.title: Minutes of the 2nd project meeting
result.description: The report will present the status in project at month 24, and the plans and measures for the last year of implementation.
